posts.text: Hot take: The next wave of AI startups won't be building foundation models. They'll be building the picks and shovels — evals, observability, fine-tuning infrastructure. The unsexy stuff is where the money is.
posts.whyInteresting: Relevant topic · Good reply opportunity · High engagement

posts.text: Just shipped v2 of our crypto settlement layer. 3ms finality, $0.001 per tx. The future of payments isn't blockchain OR traditional rails — it's both, abstracted away. Users shouldn't care what's under the hood.

Unpopular opinion: Most YC companies fail not because of product-market fit issues, but because founders can't hire. The #1 skill nobody teaches you is how to convince someone to join your 4-person company over Google. Thoughts?
posts.whyInteresting: Relevant topic · Good reply opportunity · Active discussion · High engagement

posts.text: We're seeing DeFi TVL hit new ATHs on chains nobody was talking about 6 months ago. The market is rotating faster than ever. If you're still thinking in terms of 'Ethereum vs Solana' you're playing last cycle's game.

Thread: I interviewed 50 engineers who left FAANG for startups in the last year. The #1 reason wasn't money or equity. It was 'I wanted to ship something that matters before I turn 35.' The existential clock is real.
posts.whyInteresting: Relevant topic · Good reply opportunity · High engagement

posts.text: Just open-sourced our internal tool for LLM eval pipelines. 200 stars in the first hour. Sometimes the best marketing is just making useful things free. Link in bio.
